In: lib/selenium_on_rails/test_builder.rb

include_partial(path, local_assigns = {})

Includes a partial. The path is relative to the Selenium tests root. The starting _ and the file extension doesn’t have to be specified. 

  #include test/selenium/_partial.*
  include_partial 'partial'
  #include test/selenium/suite/_partial.*
  include_partial 'suite/partial'
  #include test/selenium/suite/_partial.* and provide local assigns
  include_partial 'suite/partial', :foo => bar

[Source]

    # File lib/selenium_on_rails/test_builder.rb, line 33
33:   def include_partial path, local_assigns = {}
34:     partial = @view.render :partial => path, :locals => local_assigns
35:     @output << partial
36:   end
open(url)

Open the page specified by url and wait. The url may either by a string, or arguments suitable for ActionView::UrlHelper#url_for. 

  open '/'
  open :controller => 'customer', :action => 'list'

[Source]

    # File lib/selenium_on_rails/test_builder.rb, line 42
42:   def open url
43:     command 'open', url_arg(url)
44:   end

select(drop_down_locator, option_specifier, options={})

Select an option from a select menu. Supports a :wait => true option.

63:             option_specifier)

select_window(window_id)

Select a popup window by name, and send further commands to it. If window_id is nil, select the main window.

[Source]

    # File lib/selenium_on_rails/test_builder.rb, line 68
68:   def select_window window_id
69:     command 'selectWindow', window_id||'null'
70:   end
setup(options = {})

Tell Selenium on Rails to clear the session and load any fixtures. DO NOT CALL THIS AGAINST NON-TEST DATABASES. The supported options are :keep_session and :fixtures 

  setup
  setup :keep_session
  setup :fixtures => :all
  setup :keep_session, :fixtures => [:foo, :bar]

[Source]

    # File lib/selenium_on_rails/test_builder.rb, line 10
10:   def setup options = {}
11:     options = {options => nil} unless options.is_a? Hash
12:     
13:     opts = {:controller => 'selenium', :action => 'setup'}
14:     opts[:keep_session] = true if options.has_key? :keep_session
15:     
16:     if (f = options[:fixtures])
17:       f = [f] unless f.is_a? Array
18:       opts[:fixtures] = f.join ','
19:     end
20: 
21:     open opts
22:   end

type(input_locator, value, options={})

Type value into the specified element. Supports a :wait => true option, which is useful if typing into the field causes another page to be loaded.

[Source]

    # File lib/selenium_on_rails/test_builder.rb, line 55
55:   def type input_locator, value, options={}
56:     command name_with_optional_wait('type', options), input_locator, value
57:   end
